lead_paragraph: At least 25 policemen were killed over two days, officials said Monday, in the first major assaults in the province since the Taliban named a new leader.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Kandahar, and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and MUJIB MASHAL

headline.print_headline: Taliban Kill 25 in Routing Afghan Police at Their Posts
headline.main: Taliban Overrun Afghan Police Checkpoints in Helmand Province

snippet: At least 25 policemen were killed over two days, officials said Monday, in the first major assaults in the province since the Taliban named a new leader.
abstract: Taliban attacks several Afghan police checkpoints in southern Helmand Province, killing at least 25 police officers.
